glosses: distance between the fingertips of two outstretched arms; fathom, armspan

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish قولاچ (ḳulaç) or قولاج (ḳulac), from Proto-Turkic *kulač. Although Kashgari puts the origin as *kol (“arm”) + *ač- (“to open, to spread”), Clauson finds this impossible.

Shor кулаш

Tatar колач (qolaç), qolaç
Turkmen gulaç
Tuvan кулаш (kulaş)
Uyghur غۇلاچ (ghulach)
Uzbek quloch
